security_audit.summary: The static analyzer flagged 151 potential issues, but evaluation reveals most are false positives. The skill uses subprocess.run for legitimate WordPress management via WP-CLI and Docker. Hardcoded URLs are configuration values, not suspicious network connections. The SKILL.md backtick patterns are markdown documentation, not shell execution. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' flags are false positives from meta field names containing underscores. The combination of code execution, network access, and credential handling is expected for a WordPress administration skill. All operations are within the explicitly declared allowed-tools scope.

content.user_title: Manage WordPress sites with WP-CLI and REST API
content.value_statement: This skill provides complete WordPress site management capabilities. Create and edit pages and posts, configure Yoast SEO metadata, upload media files, and manage WordPress settings. Use this skill to automate content publishing workflows.
actual_capabilities: Create, update, list, and delete WordPress pages and posts
Configure Yoast SEO fields including focus keyphrase, meta description, and SEO title
Upload and manage media files including featured images
Execute WP-CLI commands within Docker containers for local development
Generate SEO-friendly meta descriptions based on page content
limitations: REST API implementation for production sites is not yet complete
Requires Docker for local WordPress management or WP-CLI access for production
Yoast SEO fields require theme modifications to expose meta fields in REST API

use_cases.title: Automate content publishing
use_cases.description: Create and update WordPress pages with SEO metadata from Claude prompts without manual CMS login

use_cases.title: Manage local WordPress
use_cases.description: Control local Docker WordPress environment, run WP-CLI commands, and sync theme files to production

use_cases.title: Bulk SEO optimization
use_cases.description: Set focus keyphrases, meta descriptions, and SEO titles for multiple pages efficiently

prompt_templates.title: Create new page
prompt_templates.scenario: Add a new page to WordPress
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a page titled 'About Us' with slug 'about-us', template 'page-about.php', and content describing our company. Also set the focus keyphrase to 'company description' and meta description to 155 characters.

prompt_templates.title: List all pages
prompt_templates.prompt: List all pages on the local WordPress site. Show their IDs, titles, and current status.

prompt_templates.title: Update SEO metadata
prompt_templates.prompt: Set SEO title to 'Privacy Policy | Company Name' and meta description to 150 characters for page ID 42. Focus keyphrase is 'privacy policy'.

prompt_templates.title: Upload featured image
prompt_templates.prompt: Search Pexels for 'office building' photos, download one, and set it as the featured image for post ID 123.

output_examples.input: Create a page titled 'Contact Us' with contact information
output: To set SEO metadata, use: wp-seo.py set --post-id 156 --focus-kw 'contact information'

output_examples.input: Set SEO fields for page ID 42
output: SEO title set: 'Real Estate Services | CSR Real Estate'

output_examples.input: List all pages on the local site

best_practices: Use the local Docker environment for testing before publishing to production sites
Validate meta descriptions stay under 155 characters and SEO titles under 60 characters
Store API keys for stock photo services in environment variables or secure files, not in code
anti_patterns: Do not hardcode production credentials directly in scripts or command arguments
Avoid using shell=True with subprocess when possible to prevent injection risks
Do not skip the theme modification step when using Yoast SEO fields via REST API

faq.question: How do I connect to a production WordPress site?
faq.answer: Configure the site in the SITES dictionary with type 'rest' and the REST API endpoint. You will need authentication credentials for the WordPress REST API.

faq.question: What permissions does the skill need?
faq.answer: The skill requires Bash access for docker, curl, python3, and lftp commands to manage WordPress through WP-CLI and manage files.

faq.question: Can I use this with WordPress.com sites?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for self-hosted WordPress sites using WordPress.org software with WP-CLI or REST API access.

faq.question: How do I set up Yoast SEO fields?
faq.answer: Add the provided PHP snippet to your theme functions.php to register Yoast meta fields in the REST API, then use the skill to set SEO values.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use?
faq.answer: Yes. All operations are logged and use the explicitly declared allowed tools. The skill manages WordPress through official APIs.

faq.question: Can I create custom workflows?
faq.answer: Yes. The Python scripts (wp-page.py, wp-seo.py, wp-media.py) can be combined or extended for custom WordPress management workflows.
